Sub: Airport Security Committee (APSC) 
 
In supersession of previous Circular No.39/2005 dated 08-09-2005, the following 
instructions regarding Airport Security Committee at the airports are issued for 
implementation by all concerned: 
 
2. 
The Airport Security Committee shall be established at each airport to: 
 
(i) 
coordinate implementation of the requirements of National Civil Aviation Security 
Programme; 
(ii) 
provide a forum for discussion of aviation security matters affecting the airport 
and its users; and 
(iii) 
provide a means of communication between the Bureau of Civil Aviation 
Security and those entities directly concerned with implementation of aviation  
security at airports

4. 
The terms of reference for the Airport Security Committee shall be as under: 
 
(a) 
Coordinate the implementation of the national civil  aviation security programme 
at the airport. 
(b) 
Oversee and monitor the airport security programme, including special 
measures introduced by the airport administration, operators and airport tenants. 
(c) 
Use the national civil aviation security programme/ airport security programme 
as a guide. 
(d) 
Draw up and maintain a list of vulnerable points including essential equipment 
and facilities and review the security of those points from time to time. 
(e) 
Ensure that basic minimum security measures and procedures are adequate to 
meet threats and are under constant review, providing for normal situations and 
contingencies for periods of heightened tension and emergency situations. 
(f) 
Ensure that recommendations for improvement in security measures and 
procedures are implemented.

(h)

(k)

the Commissioner of Security (CA). 
 
5. 
Schedule for the APSC meeting 
 
The Committee must meet at least once in every month without fail. Besides above, 
the special Airport Security Committee meeting  shall be convened: 
 
(i) 
As and when it is considered necessary to do so by Convenor/ Chairman; 
(ii) 
As per directions of Commissioner of Security (CA), during alert etc., 
(iii) 
During security audit/ inspection of the airport by BCAS officers. 
 
6. 
Format for discussion in APSC  the meeting: 
 
It would be advisable to discuss the security related matters in the Airport Security 
Committee meetings (APSC) in the following format: 
 
(i) 
Pending Issues 
(ii) 
Matters pertaining to check-in area 
(iii) 
Matters pertaining to baggage-make-up area 
(iv) 
Matters pertaining to operational area 
(v) 
Matters pertaining to perimeter security 
(vi) 
Matters relating to airlines security including catering security, registered 
baggage, courier bags, cargo, etc. 
(vii) 
Matters relating to security of vital installation
